intro: Elatostema luchunense, commonly known as the Luchun Elatostema, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, commonly known as the nettle family. This species is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. The plant is notable for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in humid, temperate climates.
